editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msItem.note: fol. ii is blank. On the verso is ‘Commentarius in Dyonisium’, s. xvii.

msItem.author: Ps.-DIONYSIUS
msItem.title: De Hierarchia Caelesti
msItem.note: with the scholia of MAXIMUS CONFESSOR, transl. ROBERT GROSSETESTE, with additional annotation
msItem.incipit: Nobilitatem quidem et preclarum in diuiciis beatissimi Dionisii
msItem.finalRubric: Epigrammata in beatum Dionysium in quod de ecclesiastica ierarchia. [A partial attempt is made to render Greek script]
msItem.incipit: non inueni in exemplari greco nomen auctoris

msItem.author: Ps.-DIONYSIUS
msItem.title: De Hierarchia Ecclesiastica
msItem.note: with the scholia of MAXIMUS CONFESSOR, transl. ROBERT GROSSETESTE, with additional annotation
msItem.incipit: Conpresbitrio Tymotheo Dionisius presbiter. Hec sunt in eo quod de ecclesiastica ierarchia
Quoniam quidem que secundum nos ierarchia puerorum sacrorum
msItem.explicit: in te diuini ignis accendam scintillas
msItem.incipit: Preiacencium capitulorum doctrinam secundum duplicem facit modum
msItem.explicit: in fine expositionis prioris libri supplicaui

msItem.incipit: Intenciones et continencias singulorum capitulorum angelice et ecclesiastice ierarchie et de diuinis nominibus et mistice theologie sub conpendio et dilucide comprehendit auctor in inscripcionibus
msItem.explicit: non recte dicta Thimotheis rectificet supplicatio.

msItem.author: Ps.-DIONYSIUS
msItem.title: De Diuinis Nominibus
msItem.note: with the scholia of MAXIMUS CONFESSOR, transl. ROBERT GROSSETESTE, with additional annotation
msItem.rubric: Epigramma in beatum Dyonisium de diuinis nominibus
msItem.incipit: Dyonisii Areopagite episcopi Athenarum ad Thimotheum episcopum Ephesi de diuinis nominibus. Conpresbitero Thimotheo Dyonisius presbiter.
Nunc autem O beate post theologicas sub figurationes
msItem.explicit: ad symbolicum autem theologiam duce Deo transibimus.
msItem.note: [Followed by verses rendered in an attempt at Greek script]
msItem.incipit: Hii tres uersus quos uocat eorum scriptor epigramma
Scripturus iste pater beatus Dyonisius de diuinis nominibus qui labor excedit omnem humanam uirtutem
msItem.explicit: de diuinis nominibus hominibus affluenter tribuit

msItem.author: Ps.-DIONYSIUS
msItem.title: De Mystica Theologia
msItem.note: with the scholia of MAXIMUS THE CONFESSOR, transl. ROBERT GROSSETESTE, with additional annotation
msItem.rubric: Capitulum primum Dyonisii Areopagite de mistica theologia
msItem.incipit: Trinitas supersubstantialis et super dea et super bona
msItem.explicit: (fol. 284) ab omnibus simpliciter absoluti et ultra uniuersa
msItem.incipit: Particularum primi capituli de mistica theologie continentie
In nostris exemplaribus grecis non fuit prescriptum aliqua epigrammata in hunc librum
Mistica theologia est secretissima et non iam per speculum
msItem.note: unpr.; Thomson, Grosseteste, p. 58. Annotated throughout in two anglicana hands, one perhaps that of Henry de la Wyle (see below). fols. 286, 287–8v blank. On fol. 286v are faint early notes in pencil.

supportDesc.extent:
291 leaves (ii + 289) 330 210
250 195
The edges savagely retrimmed, affecting the marginal scholia, and spattered with red.
supportDesc.collation: a singleton, 112, 2–38, 4–712, 810, 9–2412, 258, a bifolium; the quires numbered at the beginning, probably s. xvii; catchwords.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 4 cols (15, 70, 70 and 25 mm. wide) of 56 lines. Blocks of text, written on every second line, alternate with the gloss in the two widest cols; additional glosses appear in the outermost cols and in the upper and lower margins, on lines ruled ad hoc. Running heads are between lines ruled right across the page.

handDesc.handNote: A single expert English formal gothic rotunda bookhand, writing a larger sized script for the text.

decoDesc.decoNote: None; unfilled spaces for coloured initials and rubrics.

binding.p: s. xix, sewn on five bands, presumably replacing one of s. xvii. fols. i and 289 are blank paper binding leaves. fol. 288v, formerly a pastedown (in a binding sewn on six bands), has marks of two clasps.

history.provenance: Bequeathed to the College by Henry de la Wyle (d. 1329), for whom see MS 56. UO47. 245 ‘in libraria’, valued at 24 s.
On fol. ivis ‘N. 7. 6. Art’, s. xix (repeated on fol. iiv), canc. and replaced with ‘I. 2. 3 (LXXXVI)’ in red. ‘6’ is inked on the foredge.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.
